document_data.caption: A map showing the location of Lance Rock southwest of Red Larch.
document_data.mainbody: '''Lance Rock''' was a stone monolith outside of [[Red Larch]], a few miles west of the [[Long Road]]. This landmark was {{SI|25|ft|long=yes}}, slender, and made of stone unlike any found in the region.
document_data.Geography: Lance Rock was located about {{SI|15|mi|k|long=yes}} southwest of Red Larch and stood on an open plain. It could be seen from miles away when the weather was clear. It was gray [[granite]], had nothing noticeable growing on it, and leaned to the east at about 30 degrees from vertical.
document_data.History: Sometime in the distant past, the [[green dragon]] [[Claugiyliamatar]] (better known as "Old Gnawbone") noticed a young [[red dragon]] (named [[Smergadas]]) had invaded her territory and gorged himself on the local wildlife. As he slept off his overindulgence, she brought this enormous lance of stone all the way from the [[Sword Mountains]] and dropped it on the invader.{{Cite web/Wyrms of the North/Claugiyliamatar, "Old Gnawbone"}} By the [[1491 DR|Year of the Scarlet Witch, 1491 DR]], there was no trace of the vanquished dragon, but Lance Rock still stood.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: In 1491 DR, some folks in Red Larch believed Lance Rock had an evil presence that caused a plague to threaten the town.
